div.style: background-color: #FCB706; width: 960px; display:table-cell; vertical-align: middle; height:30px; text-align:center

span.style: text-align : center; width: 960px;

h1.style: text-align: center; font-family: 'Franklin Gothic Medium', 'Arial Narrow', Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 24pt; color: #9E1000; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 5px

p.style: margin: 0px

td.p:
The Lake Linden-Hubbell Schools is participating in the federal program to provide free breakfast and lunch meals to our students (age 18 and under) who are in need during the mandated school closure, March 15 through April 30. The meals are free to all students.
Meals MUST BE PRE-ORDERED. You may do so by completing the survey (see link below). You may also reach the Food Service Department via email at drheault@lakelinden.k12.mi.us or telephone (906) 296-6211, option #4 and then #5.
PLEASE READ THE SURVEY FOR DETAILS ABOUT PICK UP DATES AND IMPORTANT DEADLINES.
CLICK HERE TO ACCESS THE MEAL ORDER SURVEY.

h1.style: text-align: center; font-family: 'Franklin Gothic Medium', 'Arial Narrow', Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 24pt; color: #9E1000; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 5px

p.style: margin: 0px

td.p:
Please use the link below to register your child for the 2020-2021 Kindergarten/Young 5's program. A registration packet will be mailed to you.
CLICK HERE for the registration form.

h1.style: text-align: center; font-family: 'Franklin Gothic Medium', 'Arial Narrow', Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 24pt; color: #9E1000; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 5px

p.style: margin: 0px

td.p:
If your household income has been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, we encourage you to fill out a Free and Reduced Lunch Application before the end of this school year. If you already have one on file, you can fill it out again with updated information.
Although the program we are currently participating in to provide meals during the school closure is open to all students, regardless of their lunch status, completing a new application may benefit you in the 2020-2021 school year. Under the National School Lunch Program, a student’s free and/or reduced eligibility status is carried over for the first 30 days of the next school year. Therefore, if your child(ren) become eligible for free or reduced meals now, the benefit will carry over.
IF YOUR CHILD WAS ALREADY ELIGIBLE FOR FREE MEALS, YOU DO NOT NEED TO FILL OUT A NEW APPLICATION.
A link to the online application form is posted below. If you would like one mailed to you, please call the school or email Lori LaRoux at larouxlo@lakelinden.k12.mi.us.
CLICK HERE for the online Free & Reduced Lunch Application.

h1.style: text-align: center; font-family: 'Franklin Gothic Medium', 'Arial Narrow', Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 24pt; color: #9E1000; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 5px

p.style: margin: 0px
p.a: Helping Young Children Through the COVID-19 Crisis

td.p:
Please click on the link below to download a flyer that provides information on how to help your children understand and cope with the COVID-19 crisis.
CLICK HERE to download the flyer.

td.style: border-style: solid none solid none; border-width: 2px; border-color: #0871ff; background-position: center center; text-align: center; height: 35px; background-color: #FCB706; background-image: none; background-repeat: no-repeat;

p.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 0.9em; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 5px
border-bottom-width: 0px;

h1.a: Welcome to Lake Linden-Hubbell Public Schools!

td.p:
Thank you for visiting the Lake Linden-Hubbell Public Schools website. Since the district was established, the Lake Linden-Hubbell Schools have provided a high-quality education to a rural Upper Peninsula community. Our campus consists of an elementary and high school building which are connected, an industrial arts education building, a track, football field and playground. Lake Linden-Hubbell is unique to the other area schools because it has a 400-acre school forest that consists of a beautiful two-room log cabin and miles of trails that are used for walking, hiking and cross country skiing. Our district is very proud of the opportunities that we provide for our students as well as their accomplishments.
Brad Codere,
Superintendent
